created_at: because it's not happening.   The OCC posts memos about option strike adjustments within a day or two of the declaration date of a special dividend.   This is an ordinary dividend that is only "special" in that there is an adjustment to the ex-date due to being over 25% of the underlying.  Go look at the dates memos were posted after any other special dividend
column4: memo date 2/3.  After the 2021 $ZIM special dividend was declared
column5: the OCC memo was published the next day.  The last memo on $ZIM after the $17 dividend in 2022 stated that no option adjustments would be made for companies that pay large ordinary dividends

body: So what's more likely
created_at: that the OCC hasn't published a memo yet because they can't figure out what to do
column3: or that there is not going to be any strike price adjustments
column4: just like they said last time.

body: $ZIM There is no guidance at this time as to potential options adjustments for ZIM options in the wake of the upcoming dividend. If option strikes are adjusted
created_at: it would be to compensate for the anticipated reduction in share price
column3: therefore ITM contracts would remain ITM and OTM contracts would remain OTM. However
column5: I cannot speculate as to whether or not an adjustment is warranted. When updated guidance is available
column6: it will appear on our public website.‚Äù
